intro: Cylindrolobus benmabantae, commonly known as the Benmabantae flax, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
